Javascript Accessor Version This demo uses an accessor to discover devices on the local area network. The accessor uses the discovery module.
The discovery module determines the host platform (Linux, Mac, Windows), then executes OS commands to find IP addresses, names (when available), and MAC addresses (when available) of devices on the local network.
By default, discovery uses the ping and arp commands. To use nmap, double-click on the accessor and check "useNmap". The nmap program must be installed on your system. See link below for nmap setup info.
For more info, please see: https://www.terraswarm.org/accessors/wiki/Version0/Discovery
